programme.desc: Sports writer Paul Hennessy is forced to view fatherhood differently when his wife returns to full-time work. programme.title: 8 Simple Rules

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

Drama, starring David Caruso and Sofia Milos.(n)

programme.desc: The disheveled cop is drawn into the world of the Los Angeles club scene when he investigates the apparent suicide of a tabloid reporter, and uncovers evidence of a blackmail plot. Detective drama, with Peter Falk, Matthew Rhys and Jennifer Sky.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: An Exercise in Fatality
programme.desc: The owner of a chain of health clubs kills a business partner who was about to expose his crooked dealings. Making the death look like an unfortunate weightlifting accident, he cunningly creates the perfect alibi using a tape recording of his victim's voice - but he reckons without the intervention of the shabby sleuth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Conrad and Philip Bruns.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The shabby sleuth investigates the complex case of a murdered Hollywood gossip writer. He uses his unique talents to interrogate a smooth-talking funeral director, who was once romantically involved with the victim and one of the last people to see her alive. Detective drama, with Peter Falk. Patrick McGoohan co-stars and directs.(n)

programme.desc: The team examines the apparently accidental death of a man trying to solve the killing of his son in Chile 30 years earlier. As the investigations gather pace, the officers are embroiled in a belated murder trial.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA World Cup 2018
programme.desc: England v Panama (Kick-off 1.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of both sides' second Group G match, taking place at Nizhny Novgorod Stadium in Russia. Gareth Southgate's men come into this fixture following a last-gasp 2-1 win over Tunisia on Monday, with captain Harry Kane proving to be his country's hero with both goals. Tournament debutants Panama did well to hold Belgium in the first half of their opener, but Roberto Martinez's side proved too strong in the second half and eventually ran out 3-0 victors. England will be looking to make it out of the group stages of the World Cup for the first time since 2010 after their poor performance at the tournament four years ago. The Three Lions drew one and lost two fixtures in 2014, failing to win a game in a group that also featured Italy, Uruguay and Costa Rica. Recently announced captain Harry Kane will lead his side out in his first-ever World Cup and will be expected to provide the goals that England have desperately needed in the group stages in the past, with the Three Lions only scoring 11 goals in 12 group matches since the turn of the century. They'll be facing opponents who are playing in their first-ever World Cup, with Panama progressing after finishing third in the CONCACAF qualifying group. They finished above the likes of the USA and Trinidad & Tobago, with the President of Panama declaring a national holiday after they made it through to the finals. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Frank Lampard and Rio Ferdinand, and commentary by Guy Mowbray and Danny Murphy.(n)

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA World Cup 2018
programme.desc: Japan v Senegal (Kick-off 4.00pm). Mark Chapman presents all the action from both teams' second matches in Group H, held at Ekaterinburg Arena, Russia. In what was widely regarded as something of a shock, both of these teams won their opening contests on Tuesday, both by the same 2-1 scoreline. Japan overcame Colombia, thanks largely to the first red card of the tournament, given to Carlos Sanchez in the third minute for handball. Senegal then defeated Poland, with Thiago Cionek's own goal and an Mbaye Niang strike proving enough for the Lions of Teranga. This is the first competitive meeting between the nations, and Japan have won both friendlies contested by the sides, though the most recent of those was back in 2002. The Asian outfit qualified for their sixth consecutive World Cup finals by finishing top of a group containing Saudi Arabia, Australia, United Arab Emirates, Iraq and Thailand. Senegal don't boast the same experience, as they are playing in their first finals since 2002, but will draw confidence from their dominant performances in qualifying, which saw them comfortably win their group ahead of Burkina Faso, Cape Verde and South Africa. With analysis from Didier Drogba, Phil Neville and Pablo Zabaleta, and commentary by Simon Brotherton and Kevin Kilbane.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker asks the questions in the light-hearted quiz, with former England cricket captain Charlotte Edwards, ex-Newcastle United and England midfielder Kieron Dyer, hurdler Andrew Pozzi and Saracens full-back Alex Goode joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker, Ellie Harrison and Steve Brown present from West Sussex, where they meet people who pay to spend their holidays staying in a church. Plus, a plan to reduce food waste and a report on the importance of beetles in pollinating plants. Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith announce the winner of this year's Farming Hero Award.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Osbourne House on the Isle of Wight, where items brought to be valued include a trunk that has travelled the world, a Japanese jar found in a water tank, a chair with a moving story, a Russian brooch that requires a secret code to be unlocked, and a locket that proves that not everyone has heard of the Beatles.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Ross makes his maiden speech in Parliament, and is reunited with an older Geoffrey Charles. While her husband is in London, Demelza has to deal with the fall-out from a failing mine and a broken-hearted Drake. Dwight and Caroline have a daughter, but their happiness is short-lived after a shocking diagnosis. Ossie is told a terrible secret by a dying parishioner, and hopes to trade the information to George, who is seeking a way to reclaim his lost political power by buying land he can corruptly control. Rebecca Front (The Thick of It) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup 2018 Highlights
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad introduces action from the day's group fixtures - England v Panama in Nizhny Novgorod, Poland v Colombia in Kazan and Japan v Senegal in Ekaterinburg. There is in-depth analysis of the Three Lions' performance against the Panamanians, and a look ahead to their final group match against Belgium. Should Gareth Southgate's side progress to the last 16, they will meet one of Poland, Colombia, Japan and Senegal.(n)

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup 2018 Replay
programme.desc: England v Panama. Another chance to see both sides' second Group G match, which took place at Nizhny Novgorod Stadium in Russia. Commentary by Guy Mowbray and Danny Murphy.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Nick Crane examines wildlife in the Firth of Forth, Tessa Dunlop reports on Victorian sewage disposal, and Mark Horton explores the railway tunnel under the Severn Estuary.(n)

programme.title: Glorious Gardens from Above
programme.desc: Horticulturist Christine Walkden explores the Scottish Borders by hot-air balloon, and discovers the role art and literature played in creating memorable gardens. She visits Abbotsford House, the former residence of writer Walter Scott, where she tries her hand at fly-fishing, and meets a woman whose family history at the property spans a century. She then visits Little Sparta in the Pentland Hills and examines a garden poem, before learning how the Royal Botanic Garden in Edinburgh was created.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don celebrates the mid-summer glory of roses in all their forms. He also plants some statuesque shrubs in pots for year-round interest, and deals with a pesky rabbit problem in the vegetable patch. Carol Klein revels in seasonal flower the peony, Adam Frost finds inspiration from the wild flowers that grow near to his Lincolnshire home, and Arit Anderson visits a garden in Derbyshire designed to capture and use rainwater. Plus, the iris enthusiast in Gloucestershire who is attempting to collect all the varieties created by one of her ancestors.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher, Margherita Taylor and Steve Brown present the show from Northern Ireland, sailing a traditionally made clinker boat down Lower Lough Erne, reporting on the rising numbers of pine martens and marking the 200th anniversary of hymn writer Cecil Frances Alexander's birth. Plus, Tom Heap talks to James Dyson about his ideas for the future of British farming and John Craven, Cerys Matthews and Simon King launch this year's photographic competition.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Having being awarded both Best in Show and the gold medal at Chelsea, Chris Beardshaw returns to tend to the rose garden. Jim McColl reviews the progress of his houseplant collection and Brian Cunningham creates a new natural feature to complement the waterfall using lady's-slipper orchids. Carole Baxter visits Richard and Ellen Firman's wildlife-friendly woodland garden near Ellon, Aberdeenshire, to marvel at their Hosta collection.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Spring Kitchen with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: TV presenter Nicki Chapman and double Michelin-starred chef Michael Caines are on hand to chat and sample great Spring dishes made with fantastic seasonal produce.(n)

programme.title: Best Bakes Ever
programme.desc: In light of Britain's baking obsession, actress and cake expert Jane Asher presents a selection of recipes from television chefs, including James Martin, Mary Berry, Paul Hollywood, the Hairy Bikers, Raymond Blanc, Nigella Lawson, Tom Kerridge, Lorraine Pascale and Rachel Khoo.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the culinary histories of some of Britain's many islands, making a tempura dish from queen scallops caught off the Isle of Man and a rich cranachan with whisky from Islay. They also travel to the Isle of Wight to enjoy the cooking of a Michelin-starred chef and sample a Jersey shellfish delicacy.(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine presents a selection of viewers' comments on BBC shows, a chance to see memorable clips, and an insight into what goes on behind the scenes of new programmes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley visits Launde Abbey in Leicestershire to discover how people are using technology in prayer. Featuring performances from Only Boys Aloud and Margaret Keys.(n)

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The Fever-Tree Championships. Sue Barker presents coverage of day seven of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the singles final. Unseeded Feliciano Lopez was celebrating in west London in 2017 - the Spaniard came from a set down to beat Croatia's Marin Cilic and finally claim the title at the 12th time of asking. Both players were among the names scheduled to compete this time around, as Wimbledon preparations continued.(n)

programme.title: Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Another two food brands seek investment. Naked Dough, operating as a pop-up in London, serves a vegan-friendly dough developed by pastry chef and co-founder Jen. They now want £250,000 to open their own shop. Premium burger stall Black Bear Burger has allowed husband and wife Liz and Stew to leave their jobs and focus full-time on the business. Now they want to take the next step but they need investment if they are to open a proper outlet. Fred Sirieix meets the teams and follows their pitches. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Deborah Meaden, Peter Jones, Touker Suleyman, Tej Lalvani and Jenny Campbell assess the profit-making potential of a final batch of business plans, including an idea for a child's toothbrush that doubles as a mobile game controller, a range of Scottish gins, and a device for relieving back pain. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: New series. Cameras follow old friends Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer as they embark on an angling trip round the UK. The first stop is Norfolk, and while fishing for tench, Bob tries to impress Paul with his childhood fishing rod - and fails. They share nostalgia for their younger years and reveal how they recently came face to face with their own mortality due to heart disease.(n)

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team takes a helicopter to the crater of an active volcano in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has rarely been studied. The mountain is surrounded by forests, which provide cover for armed militant groups, and the scientists will only have a few short hours to gather information. They then move on to the surrounding area, a dangerous landscape marked by craters from past eruptions.(n)

programme.title: Reporting Trump's First Year: The Fourth Estate
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of the New York Times and exploring the critical issues facing journalism in the wake of Donald Trump's presidency. The first episode examines the first three months of Trump's time in office, as the possibility of Russian interference in the election emerges and the media is condemned as an enemy of the people by the new president.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Award-winning stand-up comedian Dane Baptiste plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by New York comic Desiree Burch and Liverpool funnyman Chris McCausland.(n)

programme.title: Oasis: Supersonic
programme.desc: Documentary about the early years of the Manchester band who dominated the charts in the mid-1990s. The film focuses on the relationship between Gallagher brothers Noel and Liam, including their infamous sibling rivalry, and also features rare concert footage. With Noel Gallagher, Liam Gallagher, Peggie Gallagher, Paul `Bonehead' Arthurs, Paul `Guigsy' McGuigan, Tony McCarroll, Alan McGee and Owen Morris.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Kennedy Plays Bach & Gershwin: BBC Biggest Weekend
programme.desc: The violinist performs a concert of pieces by Bach and Gershwin at Scone Palace near Perth, accompanied by members of the Kennedy Band and the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra.(n)

programme.title: Cruel Sea: The Penlee Lifeboat Disaster
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting the tragic night in 1981 when Penlee lifeboat Solomon Browne attempted to rescue those on board stricken coaster the Union Star. Amid hurricane winds and 60ft waves off the coast of Cornwall, both crews lost their lives. The story is told through actual radio messages, eyewitness testimony and memories of bereaved family members.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Charting the history of the world's most destructive war, including how the story of the conflict has changed as new information comes to light and forgotten stories are remembered. This edition examines the most important accounts of the Second World War, and how understanding of them has been redefined since the conflict ended over 70 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Tutankhamun: The Truth Uncovered
programme.desc: What killed Tutankhamun? Ever since the tomb of the boy king was discovered in 1922, he has become arguably the most famous pharaoh of all ancient Egypt. But his mysterious death at just 19 years of age has never been explained. Now, Dallas Campbell reveals new scientific research aimed at getting to the truth. A CT scan of the pharaoh's mummified body creates a full-size image of the real Tutankhamun, while DNA analysis uncovers a shocking secret about his family background - and the genetic trail leads to a revolutionary new theory about his sudden and unexpected death.(n)

programme.title: Night on Film - An A-Z of the Dark
programme.desc: An alphabetical compilation of footage about nocturnal life, featuring everything from bats to vampires as the night comes alive in this unusual mixture of music and archive.(n)

programme.desc: A dog dirt-traipsing intruder is operating in the school and site manager Dave is determined to catch the culprit. Meanwhile, Mr Nasal attempts to keep his relationship with Miss Spray a secret and Mr Konnundrum is in trouble - with his mother.(n)

programme.desc: Otto learns that the Farr family treasure lies buried somewhere beneath Scream Street and forces Cleo to help him find it - by holding her heart to ransom.(n)

programme.title: FIFA World Cup 2018
programme.desc: Poland v Colombia (Kick-off 7.00pm). Mark Pougatch introduces coverage of both teams' second match in Group H, which comes from Kazan Arena in Russia. Having lost their opening fixtures on Tuesday to Senegal and Japan respectively, both of these teams will know they must win here to stand any realistic chance of qualifying from the group. The sides have not met since a friendly in 2006, when Colombia claimed a 2-1 away win. Given the South Americans' greater recent World Cup experience, they will be hopeful of another victory this evening. However, the Poles have a team that cannot be taken lightly and were in impressive form in qualifying, comfortably topping a group containing the likes of Denmark, Romania and Montenegro. In contrast, Colombia's qualification campaign went right to the wire, with a 1-1 draw in their final match away to Peru, and Chile's 3-0 defeat in Brazil, allowing them to finish one point clear of the Peruvians and Chileans in the final automatic position. With commentary by Jon Champion and Ally McCoist, and analysis by Gary Neville, Roy Keane and Ian Wright.(n)

programme.desc: A student who has given up his dreams of being a dancer in favour of his education meets a team of street dancers fallen on hard times. He is recruited into the group as they compete in a high-stakes tournament to win the money they need to secure rehearsal space. Dance drama sequel, starring Rick Malambri, Adam G Sevani and Sharni Vinson.(n)

programme.title: Love Island
programme.desc: Caroline Flack hosts the reality show in which singletons seeking a summer of romance compete to pair off in Majorca, in the hope of finding love - and winning a £50,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Love Island: Aftersun
programme.desc: Caroline Flack hosts the companion programme to the dating show, featuring the latest gossip from the Love Island villa as well as input and opinions from a celebrity panel.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg has fun partying with Peter when he takes her to a college for an interview, and Brian has to learn how to live in the wild after being sprayed by a skunk and forbidden from entering the house.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: When players from the winning side admit their victory was a result of divine intervention, Peter and his cronies go on a worldwide quest to seek out and confront God about His messing with the outcome of the New England Patriots' football games, and thus continuing their losing streak.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A friend of Jessica's wins a fortune in a sweepstake - but soon discovers her new-found wealth brings a host of problems in its wake, and realises she can trust no one. Starring Angela Lansbury and Loretta Swit.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Rosie is viciously attacked while attending a broken-down vehicle stranded on the moors. When the body of the driver is discovered nearby, Rob and Rachel are determined to solve the mystery. Their investigation leads to a chilling discovery linking the case to a religious cult near Aidensfield.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Reverend Jacob Thwaite returns home to find his wife has been murdered, but while Rachel is suspicious of his alibi it's a psychic convention in the town that seems to hold the key to the case. Meanwhile, Peggy devises a plan to sell trout to a hotel in Scarborough that lands her and David in trouble with the authorities. Trudie Goodwin guests.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Richard Abernethie is found dead shortly after disinheriting his sole heir and specifying that his legacy is to be divided equally among the remaining family members. Poirot is called in by his solicitor friend Gilbert Entwhistle, to ascertain whether the late Mr Abernethie met with foul play - and also finds time to investigate the murder of a beneficiary under the new terms of the will. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Robert Bathurst, Anna Calder-Marshall and Geraldine James.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) and four known killers are among those who meet Poirot at a bridge evening arranged by wealthy adventurer Shaitana, who sits out the first game - only to be found later stabbed through the heart. As nobody has left or entered the victim's apartment during the night, the guests combine their skills to discover which of the party is responsible. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Lesley Manville and Alex Jennings.(n)

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are hired to bring a mansion's walled garden back to life, with help from inmates of the local prison. Events take a sinister turn when the owner's cousin is found drowned in the local fast-flowing river - and become even more mysterious when, just before the inquest, Rosemary sees the dead man alive. Feature-length edition of the mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Green-fingered amateur detectives Laura and Rosemary are called in to tackle a stubborn species of weed threatening an entire year's vintage at the Crickle Valley vineyard. However, they find themselves in the right place at the right time when the body of a wine critic is discovered on the premises. Murder mystery, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A murder at a remote cottage in Northumberland takes DCI Vera Stanhope back to a place full of childhood memories and reminds her of an unsolved case from earlier in her career. Delving into the local politics surrounding a controversial proposal to dig a quarry, she and her team find motives in the unlikeliest of places - until they realise that the truth could be hidden within the land itself. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel The Crow Trap, guest starring Daniela Nardini (This Life) alongside Brenda Blethyn.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar return as detectives Cassie and Sunny, who find themselves thrown into another historic murder case with the discover of a body. This time it's the perfectly preserved remains of a middle-aged man found in a suitcase in the silt of a London river. As the detectives begin the complicated task of trying to identify the victim, four unconnected people go about their business - Brighton-based lawyer Colin Osborne, paediatric nurse Marion Kelsey, teacher Sara Mahmoud and respected police officer Tessa Nixon - unaware they are about to be dragged into the investigation. Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star, with Mark Bonnar, Lorraine Ashbourne, Charlie Condou and Wendy Craig.(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: With their victim identified, Cassie and Sunny begin to find out a bit more about David Walker by talking to his ex-wife, DI Tessa Nixon, who reveals he suffered from depression. A search through the original investigation files and some numbers from David's pager help build a picture of him - and also lead to a few potential suspects. However, his son Jason struggles to deal with the news that someone murdered his dad. Whodunit, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Lorraine Ashbourne, Mark Bonnar, Douglas Hodge, Nigel Lindsay and Will Brown.(n)

programme.title: Classic Brit Awards 2018
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Myleene Klass host the awards show from the Royal Albert Hall. Dame Vera Lynn will be receiving this year's Lifetime Achievement Award. Featuring performances from Andrea Bocelli, Alfie Boe and Michael Ball, Katherine Jenkins, Tokio Myers, Bryn Terfel, Beatrice Rana, Pretty Yende and Alexis Ffrench, plus a celebration of Andrew Lloyd Webber's musicals.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Veteran locker bidder Puffy - who also happens to be Ricky's mother - causes a commotion when she competes in a storage battle in upscale Haslet.(n)

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: Regan and Carter are confronted by a reporter with information on the unsolved Golden Maid robbery. However, the newsman's strange behaviour raises more questions than answers. Classic police drama, starring John Thaw and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur loses a fortune in cash when his wine supplier is mugged and the money he entrusted is stolen. To add insult to injury the dodgy entrepreneur becomes the prime suspect for the attack, leading him and Terry on a mission to prove his innocence. George Cole stars.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Terry tries to help his friend Kate evict some unwanted tenants, but comes to doubt her motives. Meanwhile, Arthur is desperate to get into the property market and tries to sell Terry's flat without telling him. Guest starring Toyah Willcox and Simon Cadell.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Biologist and extreme angler Jeremy Wade travels to Germany to investigate tales of a beast that has been on the prowl in European waters for the past 700 years. His investigations take him to Spain, where he discovers first-hand that as a consequence of a science experiment gone wrong, the Wels catfish is growing to man-eating proportions and is capable of everything depicted in medieval records.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: The fossil record shows that the arapaima fish has roamed the waters of the Amazon River since the Jurassic age, and uses its bony tongue to crush prey against the roof of its mouth before swallowing. Biologist and extreme angler Jeremy Wade encountered the species once before and came out second best, so this time he is taking no chances as he investigates every aspect of this huge creature.(n)

programme.title: Live British Touring Car Championship
programme.desc: Steve Rider and Louise Goodman present coverage of round five from Croft, where the 13th, 14th and 15th races of the season are scheduled to take place, with Colin Turkington looking to maintain his lead in the standings. When the predictions made for her friends by the psychic come true, she realises she has to conquer her fear of settling down and find the right man as quickly as possible. Romantic comedy, starring Rachel Boston and Kirby Morrow.(n)

programme.title: With This Ring
programme.desc: Singletons Trista, Viviane and Amaya each vow to get married within the space of year while attending the wedding of a mutual friend on New Year's Eve. However, the trio must first get over their current disfunctional romances, as Trista struggles with her feelings over commitment-phobic boyfriend Damon, Viviane remains desperately in love with her old flame Sean - the father of her son, and Amaya is determined to break up the unhappy marriage of her current beau Keith. Romantic comedy, starring Regina Hall, Jill Scott and Eve.(n)

programme.title: Stop the Wedding
programme.desc: Young attorney Anna Colton discovers her naive, widowed Aunt Belle is about to tie the knot with Sean Castleberry, a Hollywood star known for his many failed marriages. Determined to stop the wedding, she teams up with Castleberry's doctor son, Clay, who does not seem too keen on gaining a new step-mother, and while the pair initially find each other irritating, a spark of attraction develops. Romantic drama, based on the novel by Stephanie Bond, starring Rachel Boston and Niall Matter.(n)

programme.title: Bridal Boot Camp
programme.desc: Anxious bride-to-be Andy wonders whether she has what it takes to `be a wife', and books herself in to a bridal boot camp to prepare herself for married life. However, the experience quickly proves it is going to present her with more questions than answers, particularly when she encounters handsome deliveryman Casey, who not only doesn't believe in marriage, but also manages to convince Andy she too has doubts about her relationship. Romantic comedy, starring Spencer Locke and Jake Sandvic.(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Bride
programme.desc: Former marriage counsellor Molly White switches careers, becoming a fitness instructor who specialises in helping brides and grooms get into peak physical and mental condition ahead of their big day. When her bridal boot-camp brings her into contact with talented photographer Nick, who seems to be having doubts about tying the knot with his perfectionist fiancee, Molly is forced to confront her own past and find a way to move on with her life. Romantic drama, starring Pascale Hutton and Kavan Smith.(n)

Romantic comedy drama, with Brooke D'Orsay, Wes Brown and Marilu Henner.(n)

Comedy, starring Jes Macallan and April Bowlby.(n)

programme.title: Kill 'em All: American War Crimes in Korea
programme.desc: The shocking story of one of the largest massacres of civilians in American military history at No Gun Ri in South Korea in July 1950. Using first-hand accounts from Korean and American eyewitnesses and recently declassified documents, the film reveals how US commanders issued orders to open fire on unarmed civilians, including women and children.(n)

programme.title: The Victorians
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman employs 19th-century paintings to explore the urban expansion that took place in Victorian Britain. Travelling to Manchester, he tells the story of James Sharples, the ironworker painter who depicted the Industrial Revolution, before visiting Glasgow's Kelvingrove Art Gallery and then following in the footsteps of Gustave Dore, who detailed the squalor of London's East End.(n)

programme.title: The Victorians
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman explores how the era's artists portrayed domestic life, and contrasts paintings of pampered middle-class children with those depicting the poor. He also investigates sexual double standards, discovers some of the bizarre ways in which desires were kept in check, and visits an anatomy museum containing waxwork replicas of flesh diseased by syphilis.(n)

programme.title: The Victorians
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman continues his journey around Victorian Britain through the art of the era, exploring the power of the British Empire. He views a CGI re-creation of the Crystal Palace - the venue for the Great Exhibition of 1851, in which the nation celebrated its widespread influence. He also examines works that depict the rise of mass advertising and the consequences of workers being forced off the land, and tells the story of a pivotal London dock strike in 1889.(n)

programme.title: The Victorians
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman reveals how, in the final years of Victoria's reign, artists led a revolt against materialistic social values, preferring to depict an idealised world filled with knights, damsels and fairies. In addition to meeting two spiritualist mediums, who give him their view of the subject, he visits Broadmoor hospital, where painter Richard Dadd spent his final years.(n)

programme.title: The Medici: Godfathers of the Renaissance
programme.desc: The rise of the Medici banking family and the human stories behind the Italian Renaissance, beginning with the life of Cosimo de Medici who, after a bitter struggle with the rival Abizzi family, came to be recognised as one of the most powerful men in Florence. He oversaw the revival of classical art, commissioning the greatest craftsmen of the era, from Donatello to Gozzoli.(n)

programme.title: The Medici: Godfathers of the Renaissance
programme.desc: The turbulent life of Lorenzo de Medici. He became the head of the family at the age of 20, and tolerated fresh ideas that encouraged the likes of Michelangelo and Botticelli to produce their greatest works. However, he failed to anticipate the advent of the radical monk Savonarola, which led to the Bonfire of the Vanities and had serious implications for the family's future.(n)

programme.title: The Medici: Godfathers of the Renaissance
programme.desc: How Giulio de' Medici and his cousin Giovanni returned from their enforced exile by assembling an army and storming Florence, overcoming the opposing forces to regain control of the city. There followed a period of excess, but when Giovanni, now Pope Leo X, funded his extravagances by agreeing to sell papal indulgences, he triggered a series of events which again saw the family face disaster.(n)

programme.title: The Medici: Godfathers of the Renaissance
programme.desc: The rise of Cosimo de' Medici who, aided by his marriage to a Spanish princess, managed to extend his power over the whole of Tuscany. However, a disagreement about the family's sponsorship of Galileo, the greatest scientist of the age, threatened to destroy everything they had achieved, and the era of the Renaissance seemed to have run its course.(n)

programme.desc: Three more sets of parents-to-be arrive at Liverpool Women's Hospital to welcome new additions to their families, including 29-year-old Kate and her 32-year-old husband Pete, whose short-term memory was damaged following a hard-fought battle against meningitis and encephalitis 10 years earlier. The pair hope Pete's brain injury will not stop him from being able to recall this memorable moment in the future. Also featured is third-time mother Lisa, whose previous two labours only lasted six and four hours respectively, and former drama school student Hayley, who already has children with her other-half Stephen, and has resolved to appreciate every moment with her family after losing her own mother at an early age.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux's LA Stories
programme.desc: California has some of the toughest regulations controlling sex offenders anywhere in America - after leaving prison they can spend years on parole being tagged and tracked and a lifetime on an online register. In his final film exploring different aspects of life in Los Angeles, Louis Theroux visits hostels to talk to parolees as well as the people charged with monitoring them, and asks whether the restrictions keep society safer and when, if ever, it is right to give sex offenders a second chance.(n)

programme.title: Pele 1-0
programme.desc: Rhaglen arbennig wrth i Gary Slaymaker deithio i Zurich i gwrdd a ?Brenin y bel gron', Pele. Byddwn yn cofio'n arbennig am y gem bel-droed fawr rhwng Cymru a Brasil yn rownd y chwarteri pan sgoriodd y bachgen 7 oed, Pele, y gol a sicrhaodd fuddugoliaeth i Frasil. Gary Slaymaker travels to Zurich to meet former Brazil forward Pele. The programme looks at the history of Wales' campaign in the 1958 World Cup, the only one the national team has ever reached, and remembers the Wales v Brazil quarter-final, when the 17-year-old starlet Pele broke Welsh hearts with the only goal of the game.(n)

Animation, featuring the voices of John Fiedler, Jim Cummings and Andre Stojka.(n)

programme.desc: A Native American boy plots revenge when his father is killed by a bear that was protecting its young. Animated adventure, with the voices of Joaquin Phoenix, Rick Moranis and Dave Thomas.(n)

programme.title: Hocus Pocus
programme.desc: A teenager in Salem, Massachusetts, breaks into a spooky house on Halloween and accidentally resurrects three witches who have been dead for 300 years. The sorceresses are soon causing chaos while seeking a suitable sacrifice for a ritual to give them eternal youth. However, an old foe - a boy they turned into a cat - is on hand to help stop their mischief. Supernatural Disney comedy, with Bette Midler, Sarah Jessica Parker, Kathy Najimy and Omri Katz.(n)

programme.title: The Emperor's New Groove
programme.desc: A spoilt and uncaring emperor learns the importance of treating people fairly when a sorceress turns him into a llama so she can seize power herself. His only hope of getting his kingdom back is to seek the help of a peasant he had previously mistreated. Animated Disney comedy, featuring the voices of David Spade, John Goodman, Patrick Warburton and Eartha Kitt.(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood
programme.desc: The adventures of the legendary outlaw and Sherwood Forest's band of heroes as they rob the rich to feed the poor, while evil Prince John hatches a cunning plan to exact revenge and finish off the brigands. Disney animation, with the voices of Terry-Thomas, Peter Ustinov, Phil Harris, Brian Bedford and Monica Evans.(n)

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the later life of novelist CS Lewis, detailing how he fell in love with American poet Joy Gresham, only to see his new-found happiness marred by tragedy and illness. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger, Edward Hardwicke, John Wood, Michael Denison and Joseph Mazzello.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the latest trip into JK Rowling's wizarding world, including interviews with stars Eddie Redmayne and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Run the Tide
programme.desc: Texas twentysomething Rey Hightower attempts to keep his younger brother away from their ex-con mother. Drama, starring Taylor Lautner, Constance Zimmer and Kenny Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: An aristocratic Englishwoman inherits a vast cattle station in the Australian Outback in the 1930s. When her land comes under threat from a rival farmer aiming to build a monopoly, she is forced to lead her herd across the wilderness to secure the farm's future, falling for a tough stock-man and forming a friendship with a half-Aboriginal boy along the way. However, as they make their journey, the country becomes drawn into the Second World War. Baz Luhrmann's romantic drama, starring Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman.(n)

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenager's body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiner's 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry O'Connell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss.(n)

programme.title: Gifted
programme.desc: Single man Frank Adler attempts to raise his child prodigy niece, Mary. However, his plans for a normal school life for the youngster are foiled when the youngster's mathematical abilities come to the attention of Frank's formidable mother, Evelyn. Drama, starring Chris Evans, Lindsay Duncan and Mckenna Grace.(n)

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: The spirit of a murdered executive tries to find a way to help his girlfriend bring his killer to justice and enlists the aid of a fraudulent medium - who is amazed and baffled when her psychic powers turn out to be all too real. Romantic fantasy, starring Patrick Swayze, Demi Moore, Tony Goldwyn and an Oscar-winning Whoopi Goldberg.(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: A manager for an American courier service has to fend for himself when a plane crash leaves him stranded alone on a desert island. Initially panic-stricken, he overcomes his terror to survive for four years on his own before building a raft and setting off on an epic journey back home. Adventure drama, starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Nick Searcy, Lari White and Chris Noth.(n)

programme.desc: Put to work by an evil kennel owner, Ozzy the beagle and his fellow canine inmates band together and launch a daring escape attempt. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Jacob Tremblay, Will Sasso and Jeff Foxworthy.(n)

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: A young family cursed by a witch and transformed into monsters. Animated comedy, with the voices of Emily Watson, Jason Isaacs and Nick Frost.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age
programme.desc: Three mismatched prehistoric animals join forces to return a human infant to its tribe - but as their journey unfolds, the creatures fail to anticipate the many perils and pitfalls that lay in store for them. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of John Leguizamo, Ray Romano, Denis Leary, Goran Visnjic and Jack Black.(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: Animated adventure about a world where storks now deliver everything but babies, until an office mishap that is. With the voices of Andy Samberg, Kelsey Grammer and Katie Crown.(n)

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: A man who has been trapped inside a mysterious jungle board game for 26 years is eventually freed when two children start to play it. Unfortunately, he arrives with a rampaging horde of animals on his heels, leaving only one solution - to finish the game he started all those years ago. Fantasy adventure, starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst and Bonnie Hunt.(n)

Meanwhile, Baron Bomburst, the blundering ruler of Vulgaria, will do anything to get his greedy hands on it. Children's musical adventure, based on the book by Ian Fleming, starring Dick Van Dyke, Lionel Jeffries, Sally Ann Howes, Gert Frobe, Benny Hill and James Robertson Justice.(n)

programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl struggles to cope with the torments of growing up, fitting in and finding a boyfriend. Tired of being a social outcast, she plans to throw the perfect birthday party to win the respect of her peers. Comedy drama based on Louise Rennison's series of novels, starring Georgia Groome, Alan Davies, Karen Taylor and Aaron Taylor-Johnson.(n)

Adventure, starring Jordan Dulieu, Annabel Wolfe and Scott Irwin.(n)

programme.desc: An android-hunter's discovery of a long-buried secret leads him to track down former detective Rick Deckard, who's been missing for 30 years. Denis Villeneuve's Oscar-winning sci-fi thriller, starring Ryan Gosling, Harrison Ford and Jared Leto.(n)

programme.title: Victoria & Abdul
programme.desc: Premiere. Queen Victoria strikes up an unlikely friendship with a young Indian clerk named Abdul Karim. Stephen Frears drama, starring Judi Dench, Ali Fazal and Tim Pigott-Smith.(n)

programme.desc: A farmer with dreams of becoming a wizard finds an abandoned baby, who is destined to bring about the downfall of an evil queen. The wicked tyrant's minions have been sent to kill the child before she can fulfil the prophecy, and it falls to the would-be sorcerer to protect her, with the aid of a rogue warrior. Fantasy adventure, starring Warwick Davis and Val Kilmer.(n)

programme.title: Titan AE
programme.desc: In the year 3038, an alien race has annihilated almost all of mankind and destroyed the Earth. A scientist escapes the planet on board a craft that is destined to be humanity's only chance of future survival - the spaceship Titan. Fourteen years later, his estranged son plucks up courage and sets out on a perilous journey to find the ship and reunite with his father. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Matt Damon, Bill Pullman and Drew Barrymore.(n)

programme.title: Shin Godzilla
programme.desc: Japan is plunged into chaos upon the appearance of a giant monster. Fantasy adventure, starring Hiroki Hasegawa, Yutaka Takenouchi and Satomi Ishihara.(n)

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriend's father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard.(n)

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: A young lad is transported to a parallel universe where he is caught in a battle between a mysterious gunslinger and a sinister sorcerer. Fantasy adventure based on the Stephen King novels, starring Idris Elba, Matthew McConaughey and Tom Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show viewers the best of what is on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: A team of scientists on the International Space Station fight for survival when an intelligent alien life form is brought on board. The creature, nicknamed Calvin, proves it will do anthing to stay alive, and the crew risk everything to ensure it does not make its way to Earth. Sci-fi thriller, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Rebecca Ferguson, Ryan Reynolds and Ariyon Bakare.(n)

programme.title: Patient Seven
programme.desc: A renowned psychiatrist selects six mentally ill hospital patients to interview as part of research for his new book, and discovers one patient is connected to them all. Horror anthology, starring Michael Ironside, Jack Plotnick and Drew Fonteiro.(n)

programme.title: Heaven Knows, Mr Allison
programme.desc: A US marine corporal stationed on a South Pacific island and a novice nun on a mission are forced into the hills when Japanese forces arrive and set up military bases during the Second World War. Before long the pair develop strong emotional ties, but in resisting their feelings for each other the relationship becomes one of deep mutual respect. Romantic drama, written and directed by John Huston, with Robert Mitchum and Deborah Kerr.(n)

programme.title: To Catch a Thief
programme.desc: A retired cat burglar becomes the prime suspect for a series of robberies carried out in his own distinctive style, and sets out to clear his name by catching the copycat crook responsible. His quest takes him to the Cote d'Azur, where he encounters the demure daughter of a wealthy holiday-maker, and before long the two are drawn together. Alfred Hitchcock's Oscar-winning romantic mystery, starring Cary Grant, Grace Kelly and Jessie Royce Landis.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: A shy, naive lawyer falls foul of a gunslinger while on his way to the backwoods town of Shinbone. His life is saved by a local woman, and he in turn devotes himself to helping the townsfolk while searching for a way to bring the bandit to justice. However, he finally comes to realise that a more aggressive approach will be needed. John Ford's Western, starring James Stewart, Lee Marvin, John Wayne, Woody Strode and Vera Miles.(n)

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Rebellious American teenager Danny falls for innocent Australian girl Sandy during summer holidays, but when he later finds out she is a new student at his school, he risks losing her love by trying to act cool in front of his friends. Romantic musical set in 1950s, starring John Travolta, Olivia Newton-John, Stockard Channing, Jeff Conaway, Didi Conn and Sid Caesar.(n)

programme.title: West Side Story
programme.desc: Two teenagers from rival New York street gangs, the Jets and the Sharks, fall in love - but it causes already simmering tensions to explode. Leonard Bernstein and Stephen Sondheim's Oscar-winning musical based on Romeo and Juliet, adapted from the stage play, starring Natalie Wood, Richard Beymer, Russ Tamblyn, Rita Moreno and George Chakiris.(n)

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: An American prizefighter retires after killing an opponent in the ring, and returns to his Irish roots in a village in Galway, where he falls for a local woman. Unfortunately, their romance is hampered by a conflict with her brother over a property matter. John Ford's Oscar-winning romantic comedy drama, starring John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Victor McLaglen, Barry Fitzgerald and Ward Bond.(n)

programme.title: Serpico
programme.desc: An idealistic undercover cop in 1960s New York is ostracised by his fellow officers for his refusal to take bribes. Sickened by the widespread corruption in the force and the refusal of his superiors to do anything, he sets out to publicly expose the guilty parties, putting his own life on the line in the process. Fact-based drama directed by Sidney Lumet, starring Al Pacino and John Randolph.(n)

programme.title: United
programme.desc: Feature-length drama charting the story of the `Busby Babes' - the Manchester United side who became the youngest-ever winners of the English Football League in 1956. Having won the league again in 1957, the team reaches the quarter-finals of the European Cup in 1958 - but disaster strikes as they return from the match in Belgrade, when their charter plane crashes following a refuelling stop in Munich. The disaster claims the lives of 23 people, including eight players - and with manager Matt Busby in a critical condition, coach Jimmy Murphy tries to rebuild the shattered team. Starring David Tennant, Jack O'Connell, Sam Claflin and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.desc: A widowed father is coping badly with his wife's death, but his son is convinced that what he really needs is some new romance in his life. He arranges for his dad to go on a radio phone-in show, and his touching story moves a reporter to respond, even though she is already engaged. She returns to her fiance, but the boy, certain she is the woman for his father, plots to bring them together. Romantic comedy, with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Merlin

Action thriller, with Jean-Claude Van Damme, Selina Giles, Mark Dymond and William Ash.(n)

Thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Richard Gere and Sidney Poitier.(n)

programme.desc: Feature-length drama charting the story of the `Busby Babes' - the Manchester United side who became the youngest-ever winners of the English Football League in 1956. Having won the league again in 1957, the team reaches the quarter-finals of the European Cup in 1958 - but disaster strikes as they return from the match in Belgrade, when their charter plane crashes following a refuelling stop in Munich. The disaster claims the lives of 23 people, including eight players - and with manager Matt Busby in a critical condition, coach Jimmy Murphy tries to rebuild the shattered team. Starring David Tennant, Jack O'Connell, Sam Claflin and Dougray Scott.(n)

Declared unfit for duty due to ill health, he is reassigned to a recruitment station - but he tricks his way back to the front line to protect the brother of the woman he loves. Drama, directed by and starring Paul Gross. With Caroline Dhavernas and Joe Dinicol.(n)

programme.desc: The story of Stanislav E Petrov, a former lieutenant colonel in the Soviet army who, in 1983, averted nuclear war by refusing to launch a retaliatory strike against incoming US missiles - intelligence that turned out to be false. The film combines drama and documentary, with the story of those few tense hours intercut with footage of the real Petrov as he is now. Sergey Shnyryov stars as the young Petrov, with appearances from the likes of Kevin Costner, Walter Cronkite, Robert De Niro, Matt Damon and Ashton Kutcher.(n)

programme.desc: When Wayne Rooney scored against Switzerland at Wembley in September, he became England's all-time leading scorer - eclipsing a record held by Bobby Charlton for almost half a century. In this programme, Gary Lineker explores the Manchester United striker's life and career, chatting to Rooney about his upbringing in Liverpool and the early years of his relationship with wife Coleen. Meera Syal, Neve McIntosh and Robert Pugh guest star alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who

However, the leader of the reptiles' military is determined to wage war, while some of the humans plot a desperate reprisal of their own. Meera Syal, Neve McIntosh and Robert Pugh guest star alongside Matt Smith, Karen Gillan and Arthur Darvill.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord and Amy travel to 19th-century Provence, where they join forces with Vincent Van Gogh to battle an invisible alien only the artist can see. As well as combating the terrors that lurk in the cornfields, they try to restore the sad and lonely painter's happiness. Written by Richard Curtis (Love Actually) and guest starring Tony Curran (This Life) and Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord passes himself off as a human so he can investigate a series of mysterious disappearances in which people go up the stairs of a house on Aickman Street, but never come down. To do so, he decides to share a flat with a man called Craig - played by James Corden (Gavin & Stacey). Also guest starring Daisy Haggard (Green Wing) alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Time Lord receives a warning from his friends about the opening of the Pandorica, a box that legend says is a prison for the most deadly being in the universe. As the Doctor resolves to stop the threat, he finds that the key could be a love story that survives for thousands of years. Matt Smith and Karen Gillan star, with Alex Kingston returning as River Song.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. With the Tardis destroyed and the Doctor gone, there is only one person who can stop the whole universe collapsing - a scared girl who still believes in stars. Finale of Matt Smith and Karen Gillan's first run as the Doctor and Amy Pond, with Alex Kingston returning as River Song.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. With the mysterious missives still unexplained, the time traveller agrees to investigate further, and his quest takes him to 1969 - and an encounter with US president Richard Nixon and a sinister astronaut.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. As an alien force occupies Earth, Canton Delaware sets out to free the Doctor from the perfect prison and reunite him with Amy, Rory and River Song. With the help of President Nixon, the heroes resolve to lead the hypnotised human race in a revolution against the invaders, in the hope of driving them out and rescuing the missing child.(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Festive edition of the family comedy from 2009. It is Boxing Day in the Brockman household and Santa has paid a visit - along with some burglars. Seven-year-old Karen is obsessing about a missing hamster, nine-year-old Ben is causing havoc with a mechanical hand, Jake and mum Sue are trying to find Grandad, and dad Pete is preparing for dinner guests - some welcome, some not. Hugh Dennis and Claire Skinner star as the harassed parents, with Tyger Drew-Honey, Daniel Roche and Ramona Marquez as their smarter-than-smart kids. Written by Andy Hamilton and Guy Jenkin.(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2011. The Brockmans plan to escape the festivities by spending Christmas in the sun - but fate intervenes. Grandad has been taken ill and is languishing in the hospital from hell, Karen has toothache, so her festive treat is a visit to the emergency dentist, and Ben attempts to beat a world record involving knives. Meanwhile, family friend Jane and her ex-convict boyfriend take up residence in the family's home.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Actress Tamzin Outhwaite sets out to learn about her Italian roots on the maternal side of her family as a result of her fond childhood memories of big meals with relatives, antipasto and energetic conversations. Her journey begins in the heart of London's East End, where her great-grandfather Tony Gonella once ran a cafe. She visits the Isle of Man, Italy and finally Glasgow as she explores her ancestor's life, and also discovers more about her mother's father Remo Santi and his dad Adelmo.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: The Yorkshire Air Ambulance crew is called to rescue a man trapped under a tractor that has plunged off a bridge and is in danger of sinking. Paramedic Paul is concerned his patient may go into cardiac arrest - and there's a real chance he may drown if firefighters cannot free him. The chopper lands on a farm to save a farmer who's been attacked by his own herd of cattle. Plus, on a road over the North York Moors, a wild deer runs out in front of a biker and leaves him with serious injuries.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: Cameras follow the flying doctors and paramedics of the Yorkshire Air Ambulance. A boy suffers a fractured skull after falling through a roof, and wintry weather causes problems.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Under the Knife
programme.desc: The roving broadcaster travels to California, the birthplace of plastic surgery, to investigate the obsession with beauty and self-image. In his quest he meets Eve, a domineering stylist and her client Laura, and DJ Kris, who is resorting to liposuction to achieve the six-pack he so desires, leading Louis to consider having a nip and tuck himself.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: West Midlands Ambulance paramedics answer the call of more people in need, and Hannah and Amy treat a teenager whose pain has left her unable to speak.(n)
